usa: United States v. Butler: The Supreme Court ruled that the processing taxes instituted under the 1933 Agricultural Adjustment Act were unconstitutional.[149]
The Second London Naval Treaty was signed.<sup id="cite_ref-150" class="reference">[150]</sup>
The Robinson-Patman Act was signed into law.<sup id="cite_ref-151" class="reference">[151]</sup>
United States presidential election, 1936: President Franklin Delano Roosevelt was reelected to a second term, defeating Kansas Governor Alf Landon.[152]
The Flint Sit-Down Strike began.<sup id="cite_ref-153" class="reference">[153]</sup>
